author: coar
msg: Document the last two Win32 fixes.

author: coar
msg: ap_os_canonical_filename was not treating 'x:/' correctly.  The
'/' was being stripped, then we'd call GetFullPathName which
would take 'x:' and change it to the current path on x:, not
the root of x:.  Also, we'd end up adding another slash to
x:/ and leave the routine with a 'x://'.
Submitted by:	Ken Parzygnat <kparz@raleigh.ibm.com>
Reviewed by:	Ben Laurie, Ken Coar

author: coar
msg: ap_sub_req_lookup_file() was assuming that all absolute paths
begin with "/" -- which obviously isn't the case for Win32.
#ifdef this to do the right thing on Win32.  (It's unclear
whether a leading "/" should still be considered a valid absolute
path for Win32, since it's thereby inheriting the current
drive.  At least most of the hole is closed.)
Submitted by:	Ken Parzygnat <kparz@raleigh.ibm.com>
Reviewed by:	Ken Coar
